intro: Dorstenia howardii, commonly known as the "Hairy Fig Plant," is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves that resemble the structure of a fig. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences, and it is known for its ability to thrive in shaded, humid environments. Dorstenia howardii is also notable for its use in traditional medicine and as an ornamental plant in botanical gardens.
